Maybe we should also break reactive mongo panache compatibility, by returning a Uni<InsertOneResult> here?
But we should at least try to be consistent between reactive mongo and reactive panache mongo.
timeline.author: Postremus

replies.bodyText:
@Postremus we try to avoid returning mongodb specific objects inside Panache.
Update and delete didn't return UpdateResult nor DeleteResult so I prefer to keep void here.
replies.author: loicmathieu

replies.bodyText: Not sure if it's possible, but maybe we could return the updated entity?
replies.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure if this should be considered as a breaking change.
Initially, it only contained Document, now it can be any type.
First I would use TDocument as in the driver to indicate that it's not any type, but must be somehow a document. The lack of constraint in the driver is a bit odd.
timeline.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: @cescoffier TDocument means any type T that can be converted to a document. I agree this is a bit odd as it didn't convey any constraint. As we register the Pojo Codec, almost any type can be converted automatically (except for some deep generic types). So maybe T is OK.
replies.author: loicmathieu
